questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks (CK) is planning to introduce a User Acceptance Testing (UAT) process to ensure quality. UAT will take place in Partial and Full sandboxes. CK has also set up the Salesforce Content Delivery Network (CDN) for its domain in production environment.

What should CK keep in mind about Salesforce CDN?

discussion.content:
I find this document saying
"Supported Environments
In each production environment, you can define multiple sandbox custom domains, but only one custom domain associated with a sandbox org can use the Salesforce CDN."
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.community_builder_cdn_considerations.htm&type=5

And the same question is answered as A in this web https://www.examgo.com/exams/salesforce/experience-cloud-consultant/

not sure the answer anymore?????

Selected Answer: D
D. Salesforce CDN is supported in all sandbox environments.

Salesforce CDN (Content Delivery Network) is a feature that helps improve the performance and delivery of static resources, such as images, JavaScript files, CSS files, etc., by caching them on servers distributed around the world. This feature is available and supported in all sandbox environments, including Partial and Full sandboxes. Therefore, option D is the correct choice.

choices.A: Salesforce CDN is only supported in Developer sandbox environments.
choices.B: Salesforce CDN is only supported in one sandbox environment.
choices.D: Salesforce CDN is supported in all sandbox environments.
choices.C: Salesforce CDN is only supported in Full sandbox environments.

questions.question_text:
AW Computing is using the Build Your Own (LWR) template to create a site for its customers. The site will showcase blog posts written by AW Computing thought leaders.

Which component should the site creator use to dynamically populate the site with blog posts as new ones are added?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The Grid component with CMS Collections allows for dynamic content population from CMS (Content Management System) Collections. In this case, the blog posts can be stored in a CMS Collection, and the Grid component can be configured to display these blog posts on the site. This setup enables automatic updating of the site with new blog posts as they are added to the CMS Collection, providing a seamless and dynamic experience for visitors.

questions.question_text:
The Experience Cloud site manager of Cloud Kicks has enabled reputation for its community members. As per the recommendation given by the Experience Cloud consultant, a decision was made to use the out of the box features.

Which two things happen automatically when the site manager enables automation? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Inactive and active members are assigned default reputation points.
choices.D: Default point system and set of reputation levels become available.
choices.B: Customer portal members gain the ability to provide badges to other members.
choices.C: Chatter influence is removed from the Contribution section on the Profile page.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A. Inactive and active members are assigned default reputation points.
D. Default point system and set of reputation levels become available.

Enabling automation for reputation typically involves setting up a default point system and a set of reputation levels. Inactive and active members are then assigned default reputation points based on their activity or participation in the community. This automation streamlines the process of managing reputation within the community and provides a standardized framework for recognizing and rewarding member contributions.
